page.title: 02ALDBROUGH FEAST
page.content: Each year, in {mid-August,} the village celebrates its {Annual Feast} which covers a full week. The origins of the present day feast are believed to lie in the{charter of 1281}granted to{John, Earl of Richmond}by{Edward I} for the purpose of holding a {yearly {fair}on the{vigil feast and morrow of {St. Michael.} The present day celebrations are organised by a comm- ittee of local residents. The events begin with a gymkhana on the Monday for children and their ponies. During the rest of the week, there are village sports; quoits;dancing around the maypole; a vegetable and produce show; a dance in the village hall and an open air service. Members of the {Showmen's Guild}bring their fairground rides and sideshows onto the part of the green in front of the Stanwick Arms and open on Monday & Tuesday.
